div.p: This value set expansion contains 3 concepts.

tr.td: An IRI string that can be prepended to the code to obtain a concept IRI for RDF applications. This should be a valid, absolute IRI as defined in RFC 3987. See rdf.html#iri-stem for details on how this value may be used.
Some other type of unique identifier; e.g. HL7-assigned reserved string such as LN for LOINC.

A short string published by HL7 for use in the V2 family of standsrds to idenfify a code system in the V12 coded data types CWE, CNE, and CF. The code values are also published by HL7 at http://www.hl7.org/Special/committees/vocab/table_0396/index.cfm

title.value: Cross-version ValueSet R5.NamingSystemIdentifierType for use in FHIR R4

description.value: This cross-version ValueSet represents content from http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/namingsystem-identifier-type|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4 that is appropriate for use but unavailable in `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/namingsystem-identifier-type|4.0.1`.

purpose.value:
This value set is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the value set `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/namingsystem-identifier-type|5.0.0` as defined in FHIR R5 in FHIR R4.
The source value set is bound to the following FHIR R5 elements: * `NamingSystem.uniqueId.type` as Required
Across FHIR versions, the value set has been mapped as: * `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/namingsystem-identifier-type|5.0.0` * `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/namingsystem-identifier-type|4.3.0` * `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/namingsystem-identifier-type|4.0.1`
The following concepts are not included in this cross-version definition because they have valid representations * `http://hl7.org/fhir/namingsystem-identifier-type#oid` * `http://hl7.org/fhir/namingsystem-identifier-type#uri` * `http://hl7.org/fhir/namingsystem-identifier-type#uuid`
Following are the generation technical comments: One or more source concepts are either not mapped or broader than their targets, so the value set relationship is broadened. One or more source concepts are narrower than their targets, so the value set relationship is narrowed. The source value set has more active concepts (6) than the target (4), so the source is broader than the target. All concepts in the comparison are listed as identical. The source and target value sets have the same number of active concepts (4). Using explicit mapping from `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/namingsystem-identifier-type|5.0.0` to `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/namingsystem-identifier-type|4.0.1` in `http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/xver/5.0/ConceptMap/R5-NamingsystemIdentifierType-R4-NamingsystemIdentifierType` (`ConceptMap-R5-NamingsystemIdentifierType-R4-NamingsystemIdentifierType.json`)
